## Rust Check is\xa0Canada's \#1\xa0rust control Organization that was established in 1972 and now has over 270 centers world wide

![This image for Image Layouts addon](https://www.rustcheck.ca/images/2022/07/25/rust_treatment.jpg)

## **Rust Check**   Rust Check is Canada's \#1 rust control Organization that was established in 1972 and now has over 270 centers world wide

Although a new vehicle starts off looking beautiful, factors such as moisture, high humidity, winter road salt and otherairborne pollutants can start deteriorating it the day it rolls off the assembly line. As vehicles continue to age, the need to maintain them takes on even greater importance. Manufacturers' innovations such as galvanizing, high tech plastics and specialized coatings have improved a vehicles corrosion resistance, but these measures are not nearly enough.

The fact is, a new vehicle is subjected to thousands of spot welds and numerous bends and folds during production.

This process damages the pre-coated metal, allowing exposure to the corrosion process. Besides cosmetic damage,corrosion also weakens a vehicle's structural integrity and can affect steering and suspension components.

That's why it makes sense to Rust Check your vehicle annually.

## Frequently Asked Questions

![Image](https://www.rustcheck.ca/images/2022/07/24/website-faq-section-user-help-desk-customer-support-frequently-asked-questions-problem-solution-quiz-game-confused-man-cartoon-character_335657-1602.webp)

Does Rust Check Void Any New Car Factory Warranties?

NO. Rust Check is an aftermarket product, but it will not void any factory warranties issued by the manufacture

How Long Does A Rust Check Application Take?

A typical application takes approximately 1 Hour

What Is Rust Check?

Rust Check is a premier automobile body panel protectant that has been used successfully since 1973. It is a light liquid product that is applied inside body sections as a pressurized spray.

Crevice areas hidden inside body sections, such as joints, folds, seams and spot welds therein, are the places where corrosion starts and spreads from. Rust Check has the light liquid consistency and the active additives necessary to penetrate deep into and protect the many vulnerable crevices found in today's vehicles.

Rust Check protects metals by displacing moisture and treating the surfaces with highly effective corrosion inhibitors. The corrosion inhibitors form an absorbed (bonded) layer on the metal surfaces. This microscopic layer acts like a series of tiny umbrellas, shielding the surface from water molecules. Just as a car battery will not work without its electrolyte, metal corrosion will not occur if moisture does not contact the metal.

What Is Your Warranty?

Rust Check offers lifetime, annually renewable warranties to all vehicles less than one model year and to qualified vehicles up to three model years old.

This is not a money-back warranty – if a vehicle rusts from the inside out, we will pay for the repairs in accordance with the Warranty Certificate.

The warranty is transferable, and has no mileage restrictions.

NOTE: The warranty is annually renewed when your vehicle is "Rust Checked" at any of over 250 Rust Check locations.

Can Rust Check Be Applied To Vehicles Of All Ages?

Sealants provide a barrier between the metal and the environment, restricting contact of water and oxygen with the metal. In order to be effective, the sealant coating must remain intact. Consequently, sealant coating rely on good adhesion to the surface onto which they are applied.

Accordingly, sealants are best applied to new metals or freshly and thoroughly cleaned and dried metals. If applied to corroded, dirty or wet surfaces, they may not adhere properly to the surface, resulting in a non-intact, unprotective coating. It is particularly difficult to thoroughly clean and dry out the critical crevices and inner body panels areas.

In contrast, Rust Check remains fluid and very mobile and can fill in pores and other voids found in deposits of rust or other corrosion products. Rust Check also provides good penetration into rusted crevices. In cases where crevices are already rusting, Rust Check's deep penetration by capillary action is of even greater importance. The active additives in Rust Check work on a microscopic scale to displace water from metal surfaces and then keep the water from re-contacting the metal.

Rust Check Coat & Protect can adhere to and protect lightly rusted surfaces. It also contains a very high percentage of active additives to "dry" the metal surfaces and keep them dry. Rust Check Coat & Protect also has considerable acid neutralizing capability.

Although Rust Check and Rust Check Coat & Protect will not reverse rusting that has already occurred, they will slow and control its spread.

Is Rust Proofing worth it in Ontario and Canada?

Yes, rust proofing is one of the best investments for Canadian drivers. Ontario winters bring road salt, slush, and constant moisture, all of which accelerate corrosion. Rust Check rust proofing helps extend your vehicle’s lifespan, reduces expensive repair costs, and improves resale value. For drivers in Canada’s tough climate, professional rust protection is always worthwhile.

When is the best time to apply Rust Protection in Canada?

The best time to apply rust protection is as soon as you purchase your vehicle, before rust can begin. However, Rust Check treatments can be applied year-round, even in winter. This flexibility ensures Canadian drivers are always able to protect their cars, regardless of season, against road salt, moisture, and temperature fluctuations.

How often should I get Rust Check treatments?

Rust Check is designed for annual application. Yearly treatments ensure that your vehicle remains consistently protected as road conditions, seasons, and exposure to salt and moisture change throughout Ontario and Canada. Regular maintenance provides the best defense against corrosion, extending vehicle life and keeping costs down compared to expensive rust repairs later on.

What vehicles qualify for the Rust Check lifetime warranty?

Vehicles less than one model year old with low mileage may qualify for a Rust Check lifetime warranty. Older vehicles can still receive up to three years of coverage. This program gives Canadian drivers added assurance that their vehicles are protected long-term with trusted rust control that has been proven effective for over 50 years.

Does Rust Check improve resale value in Canada?

Yes, professional rust protection can increase resale value. Vehicles with a Rust Check history are viewed as well-maintained, making them more attractive in Canada’s used car market. Buyers trust vehicles with documented rust control treatments, giving sellers the advantage of higher resale prices while also reducing the buyer’s concerns about hidden corrosion damage

Why choose Rust Check over dealership rust proofing in Ontario?

Rust Check has provided trusted rust protection for over 50 years, while dealership rust proofing often comes as an upsell with less focus on specialized treatments. Our nationwide dealer network ensures reliable service, transparent pricing, and proven results. Ontario drivers choose Rust Check for effective, long-lasting rust control that dealerships cannot consistently guarantee.

Can I apply a Rust Check in winter?

Yes, Rust Check can be applied any time of year, including winter. In fact, winter applications are particularly effective because vehicles are most exposed to salt and moisture. Canadian drivers don’t need to wait until warmer months; Rust Check ensures reliable corrosion protection even during Ontario’s harshest winter conditions.

How do I claim Rust Check warranty service?

To claim Rust Check warranty service, bring your warranty paperwork to any authorized dealer across Canada. Our national dealer network honors warranties for qualified vehicles. This ensures peace of mind for Ontario and Canadian drivers, knowing that their rust protection is backed by reliable coverage and support no matter where they are located.

Can I transfer my Rust Check warranty if I sell my car?

Yes, many Rust Check warranties are transferable to new owners. This adds resale value by showing that the vehicle has been protected against corrosion. Buyers appreciate the added security, and sellers can benefit from higher offers in Ontario and Canada’s competitive used car markets when warranty protection is still active.

Where can I learn more about Rust Protection in Canada?

[You can learn more about rust protection by visiting the Rust Check blog.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/blog.html) Our articles, seasonal care guides, and videos provide practical tips on preventing corrosion in Ontario and Canada. From understanding rustproofing methods to learning about maintenance strategies, the Rust Check blog is a reliable source of information for Canadian drivers year-round.

- [Facebook](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-application/rust-check-coat-protect/what-is-coat-protect.html#)

- [Pinterest](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-application/rust-check-coat-protect/what-is-coat-protect.html#)
- [Instagram](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-application/rust-check-coat-protect/what-is-coat-protect.html#)

# What is Coat & Protect?

Rust Check Coat & Protect is a premium vehicle undercarriage protectant designed to deliver long-lasting defense against Canada’s harsh driving conditions. It can be thought of as a thicker, more durable version of Rust Check, engineered with strong adhesion and excellent wash resistance. This makes it ideal for exposed undercarriage areas that face constant assaults from road salt, slush, water, gravel, and debris.

Unlike traditional undercoatings that harden, crack, or peel over time, Coat & Protect is self-healing and flexible. It eliminates messy dripping from the undercarriage but never dries out, ensuring it continues to move with your vehicle. This flexibility is important because it prevents gaps from forming where corrosion could take hold. Whether applied to a brand-new car or a trusted older vehicle, Coat & Protect delivers reliable results and helps extend the life of your investment.

![What is Coat & Protect?](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/_LEO9346-cnp-5.jpg)

## Built with Proven Corrosion Inhibitor

Coat & Protect contains a very high percentage of the same proven corrosion inhibitors that have made Rust Check Canada’s most trusted rust protection system for over 50 years. These inhibitors actively block moisture and oxygen-the two elements rust needs to form-creating a protective shield across vulnerable metal surfaces. By combining a thicker, high-adhesion product for the undercarriage with Rust Check’s penetrating liquid spray for seams and joints, the system delivers complete inside-out protection.

## [The Rust Check Two Product Process](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-application/rust-check-coat-protect/two-step-application-process.html)

When used together, Rust Check Coat & Protect and Rust Check create a two-step process tailored to the different environments encountered across your vehicle. Rust Check penetrates deeply into hidden seams, doors, and welded joints where rust begins. Coat & Protect covers exposed, high-impact areas such as rocker panels, wheel wells, and the entire undercarriage. The result is premium-quality, dual-layer protection that adapts to real-world driving conditions in Ontario and across Canada.

## Why Drivers Choose Coat & Protect

Canadian winters are among the toughest in the world. Constant freeze-thaw cycles, wet slush, and heavy road salt create the perfect storm for corrosion. Coat & Protect was developed with this reality in mind. Its unique wash-resistant formula clings tightly to metal, even under continuous exposure to water spray and gravel. By shielding your undercarriage from rust, Coat & Protect helps:

- Extend the lifespan of your vehicle.

- Reduce expensive long-term repair bills.

- Preserve resale value with a recognized protection record.

- Provide peace of mind knowing your car is guarded year-round.


## Compatible with Today’s Vehicles

Coat & Protect isn’t limited to traditional steel frames. It’s safe and effective for use on aluminum body panels, hybrids, and electric vehicles, making it a versatile solution for modern drivers. Like all Rust Check products, [it is applied by trained technicians at authorized centres across Canada](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and is backed by renewable, transferable warranties with unlimited mileage.

Rust Check Coat & Protect is more than an undercarriage product-it’s a proven system built for Canadian roads. By combining innovation, flexibility, and decades of trust, it helps.

## Stop rust from reducing your vehicle’s value.

Book your annual Rust Check today and discover why drivers across Ontario and Canada continue to choose us over traditional sealants.

[Locate a **Rust Check Centre near you** with ease.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html)

**Thunder Bay Residents:**

[If you’re in the Thunder Bay area, schedule your annual Rust Check at your local centre today](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and give your vehicle the reliable protection it needs to withstand harsh northern winters.

What is Coat & Protect, and how is it different from Rust Proofing?

Coat & Protect is our premium undercarriage treatment, designed with advanced corrosion inhibitors. Unlike traditional hard coatings that can crack and trap moisture, Coat & Protect stays flexible, sealing out salt, gravel, and water. This ensures lasting protection for the underside of your vehicle against Canada’s harsh road conditions, making it more reliable than standard rust proofing.

Do I need both Rust Check and Coat & Protect?

Yes, using both provides the most complete protection. Rust Check is applied inside body panels and seams to stop corrosion where it starts, while Coat & Protect shields the undercarriage from external salt and debris. Together, these treatments give Canadian drivers a full rust control solution for year-round vehicle protection.

Is Rust Check safe for electric vehicles?

Yes, Rust Check is completely safe for electric vehicles. Our non-conductive formula is carefully applied to avoid sensitive components while still protecting panels and seams from salt, slush, and moisture. With EV ownership growing across Ontario and Canada, Rust Check provides peace of mind by extending the lifespan of electric cars in harsh climates.

Does Rust Check void my new car warranty?

No, Rust Check does not void your new car warranty. Our rust protection works alongside factory coverage, adding protection in areas not covered by manufacturer warranties. Many Ontario and Canadian drivers choose Rust Check early, ensuring their new cars stay corrosion-free while keeping warranty coverage fully intact for additional peace of mind.

Do new trucks in Ontario need Rust Proofing?

Yes, new trucks are immediately exposed to salt, gravel, and moisture on Ontario’s roads. Rust proofing with Rust Check ensures your truck starts strong, preventing rust before it forms. Beginning early extends the vehicle’s lifespan, protects its resale value, and keeps repair costs low. Rust Check is trusted nationwide for protecting new and used trucks.

How often should I get Rust Check treatments?

Rust Check is designed for annual application. Yearly treatments ensure that your vehicle remains consistently protected as road conditions, seasons, and exposure to salt and moisture change throughout Ontario and Canada. Regular maintenance provides the best defense against corrosion, extending vehicle life and keeping costs down compared to expensive rust repairs later on.

How early should I rustproof a new car in Ontario?

The best time to rustproof a new car is immediately after purchase. Ontario’s road conditions expose vehicles to salt and moisture from the first drive. Applying Rust Check early prevents corrosion before it starts, giving drivers long-term protection and helping ensure the vehicle maintains its performance, warranty coverage, and resale value over time.

What happens if I skip a Rust Check treatment?

Skipping your annual Rust Check increases the risk of corrosion, particularly in Ontario and other areas with heavy salt use. Without regular reapplication, protection fades, allowing rust to form in seams and undercarriages. Maintaining annual treatments is the best way to ensure consistent rust control and avoid costly long-term repairs.

Do vehicles in Northern Ontario need extra rust protection?

Yes, Northern Ontario vehicles face even harsher conditions due to heavier salt and chemical use on roads. Annual Rust Check treatments provide essential protection, reducing the impact of severe corrosion risks. Drivers in these regions benefit greatly from consistent rustproofing, helping vehicles withstand Canada’s toughest road and weather conditions.

How can I prove my vehicle has been protected with Rust Check?

After each treatment, Rust Check dealers provide a warranty card or service record. This documentation proves your vehicle has received professional rust protection, which can increase resale value. Buyers in Ontario and across Canada recognize a Rust Check history as proof of reliable corrosion control and long-term vehicle care.

# What is Rust Check?

Rust Check is Canada’s premier automobile body panel protectant, trusted by drivers since 1973. For more than 50 years, this innovative product has been applied to vehicles across Ontario and nationwide, helping protect against rust in one of the toughest driving environments in the world.

Unlike heavy coatings or sealants that sit on the surface, Rust Check is a light liquid that is applied inside body sections as a pressurized spray. This unique formula has the consistency and active additives needed to penetrate deeply into the hidden crevices of modern vehicles. Joints, folds, seams, and spot welds-these are the areas where rust typically starts, and once corrosion begins, it spreads quickly. By targeting these hidden points of weakness, Rust Check provides protection exactly where it’s needed most.

![What is Rust Check?](https://www.rustcheck.ca/images/design/whatis_RC.jpg)

## How Rust Check Works

Rust Check doesn’t just cover metal-it actively displaces moisture from the surfaces. Moisture is the fuel for corrosion, and if it can’t reach the metal, rust cannot form. Once applied, Rust Check leaves behind a microscopic layer of corrosion inhibitors that bond to the metal. Think of these inhibitors as thousands of tiny invisible umbrellas: each one creates a barrier that shields the surface from water molecules.

This approach is different from traditional undercoatings or sealants, which can harden, crack, and trap moisture. Rust Check remains mobile, allowing it to creep into new seams and folds, continuing to protect even as your vehicle vibrates, flexes, and settles over time.

## Why Rust Check is Essential for Canadian Drivers

Driving through a Canadian winter means exposure to road salt, slush, and repeated freeze-thaw cycles. These conditions accelerate rust faster than almost anywhere else. Vehicles without proper rust protection often suffer from corroded panels, weakened frames, and costly repairs.

By applying Rust Check annually, drivers can:

- Extend the lifespan of their vehicles by preventing hidden corrosion.

- Improve safety by maintaining the strength of body panels and structural components.

- Save money on expensive rust repairs and body work.

- Preserve resale value, as vehicles with a recognized rust protection history are more attractive to buyers.


## A Proven System Since 1973

For more than five decades, Rust Check has built a reputation for delivering results. [Applied by trained technicians at authorized Rust Check centres across Canada, the product has been trusted by families, businesses, and fleets alike.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) Unlike one-time treatments that eventually fail, Rust Check is designed to be renewed annually, ensuring ongoing protection year after year. Many applications are backed by transferable warranties, providing peace of mind even if you sell or trade your vehicle.

## Rust Check Today

Rust Check remains the gold standard in corrosion protection. Whether you drive a compact car, SUV, pickup truck, or even an electric or hybrid vehicle with aluminum body panels, Rust Check is safe, effective, and tailored to modern automotive needs.

In short, Rust Check is more than a product-it’s peace of mind. By displacing moisture, shielding hidden seams, and providing ongoing protection since 1973, it ensures your vehicle stays safer, stronger, and rust-free for years to come.

## Don’t let rust take away your vehicle’s value.

Schedule your annual Rust Check today and see why drivers across Ontario and Canada trust us instead of traditional sealants.

[Easily find a **Rust Check Centre near you**.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html)

[For those in the Thunder Bay area, book your annual Rust Check at your local centre today](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and give your vehicle the proven protection it needs to stand strong through tough northern winters.

How long does Rust Check rust protection last?

Rust Check treatments are designed to provide protection for an entire year. They shield your vehicle through every season, including Ontario’s harsh winters. For best results, we recommend annual reapplications, ensuring your car stays fully protected from moisture, road salt, and other corrosive elements commonly encountered across Canada.

What’s the difference between Rust Check, Rust Control, and Rust Proofing?

Rust Check is our specialized spray-in liquid treatment designed to protect vehicle panels and seams. Rust Control describes our comprehensive approach, combining products and processes to prevent corrosion across the vehicle. Rust Proofing is the general industry term for all anti-rust treatments. Together, these ensure complete protection from the harsh climates across Ontario and Canada.

Can Rust Check stop existing rust?

Rust Check cannot remove or reverse rust that has already formed, but it can slow its progression. By coating corroded areas and protecting surrounding metal, Rust Check helps reduce further damage. Many Canadian drivers use it to extend the lifespan of older vehicles and minimize additional repair costs caused by spreading rust.

Does Rust Check void my new car warranty?

No, Rust Check does not void your new car warranty. Our rust protection works alongside factory coverage, adding protection in areas not covered by manufacturer warranties. Many Ontario and Canadian drivers choose Rust Check early, ensuring their new cars stay corrosion-free while keeping warranty coverage fully intact for additional peace of mind.

Is Rust Check environmentally safe?

Yes, Rust Check products are non-toxic, biodegradable, and safe for the environment. Our formulas are designed to be highly effective against rust while also meeting environmental standards. For Canadian drivers, this means you can protect your vehicle from corrosion without compromising on sustainability, making Rust Check a safe choice for both cars and the planet.

# Rust Check Two-Step Application Process

For more than five decades, Canadian drivers have trusted Rust Check to protect their vehicles from corrosion. What makes Rust Check different is its unique Two-Step Application Process, a system designed to provide complete protection by addressing both the hidden areas inside your vehicle and the exposed undercarriage surfaces.

Every vehicle is made up of thousands of seams, folds, joints, and weld points. These areas are highly vulnerable to moisture and salt but require different solutions. One product alone cannot effectively protect the entire vehicle. That is why Rust Check uses two complementary products—Rust Check and Rust Check Coat & Protect—each tailored to specific areas of your car or truck.

![Rust Check Two-Step Application Process](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/rust_panel.jpg)

## Step 1: Rust Check (Inside Body Panels and Hidden Areas)

Modern vehicles are full of hidden crevices-places you can’t see but where corrosion begins. Inside doors, quarter panels, fenders, trunk lids, and around spot welds, road salt and moisture collect and create the perfect conditions for rust to spread.

Rust Check is a light, oil-based liquid that is applied as a pressurized spray. Its thin consistency allows it to penetrate deeply into seams and crevices where thicker coatings simply cannot reach. Once inside, Rust Check displaces moisture and leaves behind a protective layer of corrosion inhibitors. This invisible barrier bonds to the metal, preventing water and oxygen from making contact-the two key elements rust needs to form.

Because it remains active and mobile, Rust Check continues to creep into new seams over time. The result is superior protection for the structural integrity of your vehicle, reducing the risk of hidden rust that can weaken panels and compromise safety.

![Rust Check Two-Step Application Process](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/rust_bent.jpg)

## Step 2: Rust Check Coat & Protect (Undercarriage and Exposed Areas)

While Step 1 protects the inside, the undercarriage is constantly exposed to harsh Canadian driving conditions. Salt, slush, gravel, and water spray attack the bottom of your vehicle daily throughout the winter months. This is where Rust Check Coat & Protect comes in.

Coat & Protect is a premium undercarriage treatment that forms an adhesive, wash-resistant, and self-healing film. Unlike traditional undercoatings that harden, crack, or trap moisture, Coat & Protect remains flexible and durable. It eliminates dripping, resists wash-off, and continues to protect even when exposed to gravel impact or road spray.

In addition to shielding against rust, Coat & Protect enhances the appearance of the undercarriage and lubricates as it protects-offering both cosmetic and functional benefits.

## Why the Two-Step System Works

By combining both products, Rust Check provides complete inside-out protection:

- Rust Check penetrates the seams, folds, and hidden areas where rust begins.

- Coat & Protect guards the exposed undercarriage and high-impact zones.

- Together, they form a dual barrier that keeps corrosion from taking hold.


This system has been trusted since 1973 and is applied only by trained technicians at authorized Rust Check centres. It’s backed by renewable, transferable warranties, giving drivers peace of mind and long-term value.

## Built for Canadian Roads

Canada’s climate is one of the harshest for vehicles. Road salt, freezing rain, and constant freeze-thaw cycles accelerate rust at an alarming rate. The Rust Check Two-Step Application Process was developed specifically for these conditions, ensuring drivers across Ontario and Canada have the protection they need year after year.

The Rust Check Two-Step Application Process is more than just a treatment-it’s a proven system that helps extend vehicle life, maintain safety, reduce costly repairs, and preserve resale value.

## Protect your vehicle’s value from rust.

Book your annual Rust Check today and see why drivers across Ontario and Canada continue to choose us over traditional sealants.

[If you’re in the Thunder Bay area, schedule your annual Rust Check with your local centre today](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and give your vehicle the trusted protection it needs to withstand harsh northern winters.

What is the Rust Check two-step application?

The Rust Check two-step application uses two specially formulated products. A light, penetrating spray is applied inside hidden seams and body panels, while a thicker product coats exposed areas. This combination ensures highly effective corrosion protection, even in Ontario and Canada’s toughest driving conditions, where moisture, road salt, and temperature changes create high rust risks.

Is Rust Proofing necessary in Ontario winters?

Yes, Ontario winters make rust proofing essential. Heavy road salt, slush, and freezing conditions accelerate corrosion on all vehicles. Rust Check treatments are designed to protect Canadian drivers year-round, ensuring vehicles stay reliable and resistant to rust despite harsh winter road treatments and extreme seasonal changes common across Ontario and surrounding provinces.

Do I need Rust Protection if I live in Western Canada?

Yes, rust protection is necessary in Western Canada. While salt may be used less frequently, vehicles are still exposed to moisture, rain, and mud, all of which contribute to corrosion. Rust Check provides reliable year-round protection for drivers in British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, and other western regions, helping vehicles last longer in diverse climates.

Is Rust Proofing necessary if I don’t drive much in Ontario?

Yes, even low-mileage or parked vehicles can develop rust. Condensation and moisture build up on metal surfaces whether or not the vehicle is driven. Ontario’s climate accelerates this process. Applying Rust Check ensures that cars, even when used infrequently, remain protected from rust damage and maintain their long-term value.

Can I wash my car right after Rust Check?

Yes, you can wash your car after Rust Check treatment, but avoid heavy power washing directly on treated panels for at least 24 hours. Gentle rinsing is fine. This gives the product time to settle and ensures optimal protection, helping Ontario drivers keep vehicles both clean and corrosion-free.

# Rust Check over sealants

## The Rust Problem Canadian Drivers Face

Every winter, road salt, slush, and moisture creep into the hidden seams and welded joints of your vehicle. Over time, these hard-to-reach areas begin to corrode, threatening your car’s safety and resale value.

Many drivers turn to thick sealants or undercoating, but here’s the problem: sealants often trap moisture instead of stopping it. Once that happens, rust has already started its work beneath the surface.

## Rust Check: A Smarter Solution

For more than 50 years, Canadians have trusted Rust Check as the proven way to protect vehicles from the inside out. Unlike sealants, Rust Check is a light, penetrating liquid mist that flows into seams, crevices, and welded areas where rust begins.

Here’s why Rust Check consistently outperforms sealants:

- **Penetrates seams & crevices** \- reaches where sealants can’t.

- **Works on new and used vehicles** \- no need for shiny metal prep.

- **Self-healing formula**\- unique electro-chemical compound with ongoing protection.

- **Moisture displacement**\- pushes out water and salt; sealants trap them in.

- **Stays flexible**\- never dries, cracks, or peels.

- **Safe & clean** \- no offensive odours or toxic solvents; overspray wipes away easily.

- **Lubricates while it protects** \- keeping parts moving smoothly.

- **Annual renewal**\- reapplied yearly for ongoing protection, with renewable, transferable warranties.


![Rust Check over sealants](https://www.rustcheck.ca/images/design/why_rustcheck-sel.jpg)

## Why Canadians Trust Rust Check

Protecting vehicles since 1973.

Used by thousands of drivers across Ontario and Canada every year.

Backed by annually renewable, transferable warranties with unlimited mileage.

Applied by trained technicians at licensed Rust Check centres nationwide.

Don’t let rust steal your vehicle’s value. Book your annual Rust Check today and experience why drivers across Ontario and Canada choose us over traditional sealants.

[You can find a Rust Check Centre Near You.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html)

## Local Note for Thunder Bay

[If you’re in the Thunder Bay area, book your annual Rust Check appointment with your local centre today](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and give your vehicle the proven protection it needs for harsh northern winters.

What’s better for rust protection in Ontario winters, Rust Check or over sealants?

Rust Check. It penetrates seams, pushes out salt and moisture, and remains flexible throughout the year, unlike sealants that dry out and trap water.

How often should Rust Check be applied?

Once a year. Each application renews your warranty and ensures maximum protection through Canadian winters.

Is Rust Check safe for painted surfaces?

Yes. Rust Check won’t damage paint, and overspray can be easily wiped off.

## Rust Check, Rust Proofing & Rust Control Basics

What is Rust Check, and how does it work?

Rust Check is a liquid spray that seeps into seams and panels, stopping rust before it spreads. It’s Canada’s most trusted rust protection since 1973.

What’s the difference between Rust Check, Rust Control, and Rust Proofing?

Rust Check is our spray treatment. Rust Control is our full protection system. Rust Proofing is the general term. All help prevent corrosion in Canadian climates.

Is Rust Proofing worth it in Ontario and Canada?

Yes. Rust proofing protects vehicles from salt and moisture damage, extends vehicle life, reduces repair costs, and helps keep resale value

How long does Rust Check rust protection last?

Rust Check lasts all year. For best protection against Canada’s salt and winters, it should be reapplied annually.

Can Rust Check stop existing rust?

Rust Check cannot reverse rust, but it slows and helps prevent further corrosion, extending the life of older vehicles.

## Coat & Protect & Two-Step

What is Coat & Protect, and how is it different from Rust Proofing?

Coat & Protect is a flexible undercarriage treatment that shields against salt and gravel, unlike hard coatings that can crack.

Do I need both Rust Check and Coat & Protect?

Yes. Rust Check protects panels and seams, while Coat & Protect shields the underside. Together, they provide full Canadian rust control.

What is the Rust Check two-step application?

Is Rust Check safe for electric vehicles?

Can Rust Check protect aluminum body panels?

Yes. Aluminum corrodes differently than steel, but Rust Check helps shield it in Canadian weather.

Does Rust Check void my new car warranty?

No. Rust Check does not void your factory warranty. It adds protection where warranties don’t cover corrosion.

How often should I get Rust Check treatments?

Rust Check is recommended once a year for full ongoing protection.

Does Rust Check improve resale value in Canada?

Yes. Ontario’s road salt makes rust proofing with Rust Check essential.

Do I need Rust Protection if I live in Western Canada?

Yes. Rain, mud, and moisture in Western Canada also cause corrosion

Can I apply a Rust Check in winter?

Yes. Rust Check can be applied year-round, including winter.

What happens if I skip a Rust Check treatment?

Skipping a year increases rust risk, especially in Ontario winters.

Do vehicles in Northern Ontario need extra rust protection?

Yes. Northern Ontario uses more salt, so annual treatments are even more important.

Bring your warranty paperwork to any Rust Check dealer across Canada.

Can I transfer my Rust Check warranty if I sell my car?

## Additional FAQs

Yes. Rust Check is standardized across Canada for consistent protection.

How early should I rustproof a new car in Ontario?

Immediately. Protecting your new car from day one prevents corrosion.

What is the difference between spray-on and electronic rust protection?

Spray-on like Rust Check is proven. Electronic devices aren’t backed by strong evidence

Do hybrid cars need Rust Protection?

Yes. Hybrids are exposed to the same salt and moisture as other cars.

Is Rust Proofing necessary if I don’t drive much in Ontario?

Yes. Even parked vehicles collect moisture and can rust.

Can I wash my car right after Rust Check?

Yes. Avoid power washing panels for 24 hours, but gentle rinsing is fine.

Does Rust Check have options for SUVs and vans?

Yes. Rust Check offers treatments designed for SUVs, vans, and crossovers.

Undercoating protects only the underside. Rust Check also protects hidden seams.

Do I need to drill holes for the Rust Check application?

# Fleets Information

A new truck starts off looking beautiful, but snow, ice, rain, high humidity, winter road salt, and other airborne pollutants start deteriorating it the day it rolls off the assembly line. As trucks age, the need to maintain them takes on even greater importance.

Manufacturer's innovations such as galvanizing, high tech plastics and specialized coatings have improved a truck's corrosion resistance but these measures are not enough.

A new truck has thousands of spot welds and numerous bends and folds during production. This may damage pre-coated metal, allowing exposure to corrosion. Besides cosmetic damage, corrosion also affects truck safety, weakens structural integrity and affects steering and suspension components. It's good business sense to protect your investment with time tested and proven annual Rust Check treatments. Rust Check delivers peace of mind for just pennies a day!

![Fleets Information](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/bigrig_rustcheck.jpg)

## Make Rust Check part of your truck's regular maintenance program for complete year round protection against rust!

Rust Check is a unique formula that penetrates into every crevice and seam, actually bonding to metal to displace and lock out moisture in critical rust-prone areas.

Rust Check cleans and protects your electrical system to ensure worry free operation year after year.

Rust Check helps to prevent door lock "freeze up" and lubricates moving parts such as power window and door mechanisms.

Rust Check penetrates and lubricates nuts and bolts to prevent them from seizing.

Rust Check helps to eliminate squeaks and rattles and ensures hinges and cables operate smoothly.

Since Rust Check actually dispels water it can be applied at any time of the year, in any type of weather.

Rust Check has a proven reputation for total protection and will enhance the resale value of your truck

Rust Check is thoroughly applied by our professionally trained and certified technicians.

## Rust Check! It works!

Prolongs the life of your truck & trailer

Safer running with fewer breakdowns

Increases your truck's re-sale value

Protects NEW & OLD metals

Deep penetrating & long lasting protection

Lubricates and prevents seizing

## Keep rust from lowering your vehicle’s value.

Book your annual Rust Check today and see why drivers across Ontario and Canada trust us over traditional sealants.

Does Rust Check protect commercial trucks and trailers?

Yes, Rust Check offers effective and affordable rust protection for commercial trucks and trailers. Our treatments are designed to protect vehicles exposed daily to harsh Canadian road conditions, reducing corrosion-related downtime and repair costs. Many Ontario businesses rely on Rust Check fleet programs to keep trucks and trailers safe, reliable, and on the road longer.

Does Rust Check offer fleet programs for businesses in Canada?

Yes, Rust Check provides customized fleet programs for businesses, municipalities, and government agencies across Canada. These programs ensure multiple vehicles, from trucks to trailers, receive consistent protection against rust. By partnering with Rust Check, businesses save on repair costs, extend fleet life, and benefit from nationwide service that has been trusted for decades.

Is Rust Proofing available for agricultural equipment in Ontario?

Ontario’s agricultural equipment faces constant outdoor conditions that promote corrosion. Our specialized treatments help farmers keep equipment running longer, reducing downtime and repair costs while improving overall efficiency in Canada’s demanding farming environments.

Does Rust Check have options for SUVs and vans?

Yes, Rust Check treatments are tailored for different vehicle types, including SUVs, vans, and crossovers. Our specialized approach ensures comprehensive rust protection for family and commercial vehicles commonly driven across Ontario and Canada.

# Why Rust Check Your Truck?

![Why Rust Check Your Truck?](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/fleets_red_trucks3.jpg)

Corrosive salt and damaging moisture penetrates unprotected metals that seep into inner panel seams, leaving behind corrosive contaminants that can destroy metal over time. This residue not only affects the appearance of your truck, but can also attack the joints and spot welds that hold your truck together. The result is a truck that not only doesn't look good, but will eventually become unsafe.

Other so-called "rust proofing" systems use tars and waxes which are not effective in stopping corrosion. They are too thick and do not seep into the tight areas where corrosion begins. In fact, some of them actually "trap in" unwanted moisture and accelerate corrosion.

Rust Check's unique capillary action allows protection to "creep" into the tight seams and crevices where salt and moisture can settle, driving them off and away from the metal surfaces of your truck for maximum prolonged protection.

## Rust Check Total Maintenance

Complete underside of cabs and trailers

Rocker panels and inside front wheel wells & liners

Fenders and fender braces, complete hood and fire wall

Slack adjusters, fifth wheel and sliders

Leaf springs and sub-frame

Jumper cord receptical

Air brake maxi pots

Transmission case, oil pan, battery box

Fuel tank, clamps and supporters

All electrical wiring, fittings and connections, including behind headlights, turn indicators, clearance lights, tail light assembly, around cab lights and horn

Apply to all trim, bumpers, chrome moldings, cowls, mirrors, headlights, pots, adjusters, cab steps etc.

Cab roof, around windshield, windshield and door pillars, doors, locks, door handles

## Make Rust Check part of your truck's regular maintenance program for complete year round protection against rust!

Rust Check is a unique formula that penetrates into every crevice and seam, actually bonding to metal to displace and lock out moisture in critical rust-prone areas.

Rust Check cleans and protects your electrical system to ensure worry free operation year after year.

Rust Check helps to prevent door lock "freeze up" and lubricates moving parts such as power window and door mechanisms.

Rust Check penetrates and lubricates nuts and bolts to prevent them from seizing

Rust Check helps to eliminate squeaks and rattles and ensures hinges and cables operate smoothly.

Since Rust Check actually dispels water it can be applied at any time of the year, in any type of weather.

Rust Check has a proven reputation for total protection and will enhance the resale value of your truck.

Rust Check is thoroughly applied by our professionally trained and certified technicians.

## Rust Check! It works!

Prolongs the life of your truck & trailer

Safer running with fewer breakdowns

Increases your truck's re-sale value

Protects NEW & OLD metals

Deep penetrating & long lasting protection

Lubricates and prevents seizing

![Rust Check! It works!](https://rustcheck.ca/images/design/fleets_red_truck.jpg)

## Don’t let rust diminish your vehicle’s value.

Schedule your annual Rust Check today and discover why drivers across Ontario and Canada rely on us instead of traditional sealants.

[Easily locate a **Rust Check Centre near you**.](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html)

**Thunder Bay Drivers:**

[If you’re in the Thunder Bay area, book your annual Rust Check with your local centre](https://www.rustcheck.ca/rust-check-dealers-serach.html) and give your vehicle the proven protection it needs to stand up to harsh northern winters.

Do new trucks in Ontario need Rust Proofing?

Yes, new trucks are immediately exposed to salt, gravel, and moisture on Ontario’s roads. Rust proofing with Rust Check ensures your truck starts strong, preventing rust before it forms. Beginning early extends the vehicle’s lifespan, protects its resale value, and keeps repair costs low. Rust Check is trusted nationwide for protecting new and used trucks.

How do I maintain my vehicle after Rust Proofing?

Maintaining your car after Rust Check treatment is simple. Wash your vehicle regularly, especially the undercarriage during winter months, to remove salt and debris. Following seasonal care advice helps prolong rust protection. Rust Check also provides blogs, tips, and resources to keep Canadian drivers informed about ongoing vehicle care for maximum corrosion control.
